title: (x) Covergirl masthead and pixel font - custom (similar to Radiant), Bubbledot Fine {Grant}
content:
hello,

does anyone know what these are?  
thanks in advance, kara

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [covergirl\_font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/typophile.com/files/covergirl_font.jpg) | 30.15 KB |
| [incredifull.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/typophile.com/files/incredifull.jpg) | 27.28 KB |
author: kasuncion6

comments.content: Kara, I would venture to guess the first one is custom. Its one word and a designer would be hired to make their look unique. Ask Hrant about the pixel font since he is so good at iding them.

Uuuh, thanks Dan but I dropped out of the ID game (in any style)  
long ago, when I realized how inadequate I am. I'm still working  
hard at <cite>making</cite> good pixelfonts though...

hhp
Good for you Hrant. Did you ever see the site Lomography.com they use pixel fonts in the best imaginable way I've seen

I believe that the pixel font is Image Club's [Bubbledot Fine Positive](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/www.identifont.com/show?7TO). The Cover Girl wordmark could be based on something similar to [Radiant](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/www.identifont.com/show?7OJ).

These good folks at Viewers Like You apparently worked on the Cover Girl typeface.

[http://viewers-like-you.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/viewers-like-you.com/ "http://viewers-like-you.com/")

Re.: Lomography.com.: The pixel fonts for the 'Lomographic Society' have been designed by Fidel Peugeot, who also created custom types for 'Spruce' and 'Line' _( Wallpaper\* )_..

_\> [www.lomofonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/www.lomofonts.com/)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021818/http:/www.formlos.net/)
